abstract.p: NBC Sports ratings for National Basketball Association finals between Los Angeles Lakers and Indiana Pacers were poor but relatively high rating for decisive game six pushed overall ratings to level just above worst ever (S)

block.p: NBC Sports narrowly avoided broadcasting the lowest-rated National Basketball Association finals when the Los Angeles Lakers clinched the series by beating the Indiana Pacers on Monday night. An estimated 45 million viewers watched all or part of the game.
The 14.7 rating for Game 6 raised the combined average for the series to an 11.6, .3 percent above the 11.3 for last year's five-game Knicks-San Antonio finals, the lowest recorded.

NBC Sports narrowly avoided broadcasting the lowest-rated National Basketball Association finals when the Los Angeles Lakers clinched the series by beating the Indiana Pacers on Monday night. An estimated 45 million viewers watched all or part of the game.
The 14.7 rating for Game 6 raised the combined average for the series to an 11.6, .3 percent above the 11.3 for last year's five-game Knicks-San Antonio finals, the lowest recorded.
Each rating point represents 1.01 million television households.
In Indianapolis, the game's local rating was a 48.2. The Los Angeles market rated a 39.2.

NBC's coverage of Tiger Woods's runaway victory in the United States Open generated an 8.1 rating on Sunday, the highest final-round rating since an 8.9 19 years ago on ABC when David Graham won the championship.
